Any نّ or مّ will have a sound that emanates from the nose. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by any of these letters ك ق ف ظ ط ض ص ش س ز ذ د ج ث ت will be pronounced with a slight nasal sound\n\nOR\n\nWhen the letter ب appears after a مْ it will be pronounced with a light nasal sound in the nose. Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by any of these letters و م ن ي will become assimilated into the following letter and will be read with Ghunna\n\nOR\n\nWhen a مْ is followed by مّ, the former will become incorporated into the latter and will be read with Ghunna. color=\'#7D7D7D\'>b>ً ٍ ٌ followed by the letter ل or ر will become assimilated into the following letter but the ghunna will not be pronounced.
Please provide the best Soomaali translation Any نْ or ً ٍ ٌ followed by ب will change into a م. Any of these five letters د ج ب ط ق when encountered with a Sukun ْ &or as the last letter of the verse need to be recited with a slight echoing or jerking sound. Using transliteration for reading/writing Quran is not correct. It may lead to wrong pronunciation and discouragement to learn proper Tajweed. check for more @ https://islamqa.info/en/191497
We should remember that Allah(swt) will give us double reward for trying to learn proper recitation [Bukhaari 4937].
You can learn from a Shaykh / \'Alim / \'Qari of your locality or from these sites
1. http://www.searchtruth.com/quran_teacher/quran.php
2. http://www.readwithtajweed.com/tajweed_letters.htm
We will soon remove this transliteration inshaAllah, as it is our mistake as well. Alternatively you can download recitation and listen in case you want to check a pronunciation.
